Class Action

java.lang.Object
Action
public class Action
extends java.lang.Object
A class representing an action in the game. Note that you cannot construct an Action object directly - you must use the factory methods draw(), play(), and target().
See Also:
draw(), play(Card), target(Card, int)

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int DRAW_CARD
    An action that draws a card.
    static int PLAY_CARD
    An action that plays a card.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static Action draw()
    Factory constructor for an action that draws a card.
    Card getCard()
    Gets the card associated with the action.
    int getTarget()
    Gets the target of the action.
    int getType()
    Gets the type of the action - DRAW_CARD or PLAY_CARD.
    boolean isTargetted()
    Returns whether or not the action targets someone.
    static Action play​(Card c)
    Factory constructor for an action that plays a card.
    static Action target​(Card c, int targetIndex)
    Factory constructor for an action that plays a card targeting someone else.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public static Action draw()
      Factory constructor for an action that draws a card.
      Returns:
      A draw action

    • play

      public static Action play​(Card c)
      Factory constructor for an action that plays a card.
      Parameters:
      c - The card to be played
      Returns:
      An action that plays the card

    • target

      public static Action target​(Card c, int targetIndex)
      Factory constructor for an action that plays a card targeting someone else.
      Parameters:
      c - The card to be played
      targetIndex - The index of the target
      Returns:
      An action that plays the card targeting the specified person

    • getType

      Gets the type of the action - DRAW_CARD or PLAY_CARD.

      Returns:

    • isTargetted

      public boolean isTargetted()
      Returns whether or not the action targets someone.
      Returns:
      true if the action targets someone, false if it doesn't
